primary.description: Deep Emerald Green - Trust, Wealth, Stability

accent.description: Acid Lime - The 'E1 Twist', CTAs, Highlights

marketing.name: The Tetris Grid
marketing.rules: Asymmetry, Visual Tension. Never fill 100% perfectly.

dashboard.name: The Control Room
dashboard.rules: Density, Data Correlation. Every pixel utilized.

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 rounded-full px-8 py-6 text-lg font-medium transition-all hover:scale-[1.02] active:scale-[0.98]
buttons.secondary: bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground hover:bg-secondary/80 rounded-full px-6 py-4 font-medium
buttons.outline: border-2 border-primary text-primary hover:bg-primary hover:text-white rounded-full px-6 py-4 font-medium transition-colors

cards.marketing: bg-white border border-border/50 shadow-xl shadow-emerald-900/5 rounded-2xl p-8 hover:border-emerald-500/30 transition-all duration-300
cards.dashboard: bg-white border border-border shadow-sm rounded-xl p-6

inputs.style: h-12 rounded-lg border-border bg-white px-4 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-primary/20 focus:border-primary transition-all

universal_guidelines: Do not use generic 'SaaS Blue'. Use the defined Deep Emerald & Acid Lime.
Avoid gradients on text unless absolutely necessary for a 'hero' moment.
Use 'Outfit' font for all headings. Do not use Inter for headings.
Buttons should be 'pill' shaped (rounded-full) for marketing, and slightly rounded (rounded-lg) for dashboard.
Dashboard layouts must be dense. Marketing layouts must be spacious (2-3x normal spacing).
All interactive elements must have `data-testid` attributes.
Never use transparent backgrounds for dropdowns or headers without a blur/scrim.
Ensure all text meets APCA contrast standards.
instructions_to_main_agent: You are building a two-sided marketplace. Strictly follow the color palette and typography defined here. Use the provided image URLs for the respective sections. Implement the 'Tetris Grid' for the landing page and 'Control Room Grid' for the dashboard. Ensure the 'Acid Lime' accent is used sparingly but effectively to create the 'E1' signature look.
